text:
1. Page Title: The Pawnshop Encounter

2. Panels:

   - Panel 1 — Setup: Raskolnikov stands, old woman glaring.
     Dialogue/Thoughts:
       • Raskolnikov: “What do you want?”  
       • Old Woman: “I’ve brought something to pawn.”  

   - Panel 2 — Setup: Close-up of Raskolnikov's watch.
     Dialogue/Thoughts:
       • Raskolnikov: “How much for this watch?”  
       • Old Woman: “A rouble and a half!”  

   - Panel 3 — Setup: Raskolnikov, frustrated, clenching his fists.
     Dialogue/Thoughts:
       • Raskolnikov: “Four roubles! It’s my father’s!”  
       • Old Woman: “Please yourself.”  

3. Layout: staggered

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov attempts to pawn a silver watch but is met with the old woman's harsh refusal and undervaluation of his item.
